intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Good morning, Ike. Today’s your first day as a professional soldier, isn’t it?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yeah, and I’m ready to go.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: What you are is late. The others were suited up and ready at the break of dawn.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Sorry. I’ll get up earlier from now on. So, what’s my first job?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: I’m talking with Titania right now. Wait outside until we’re done.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes, sir.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Very well, Commander Greil, shall we continue?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: You were telling me about some bandits that needed taking care of, weren’t you?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Correct. The request comes from a nearby village. According to our reports, the bandits are not all that strong. I think it best if I ride out and take a look. I plan on taking Oscar and Boyd along with me.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Just the brothers? Hm. Go ahead and add Ike to your team. Shinon, Gatrie, and I can handle the other two jobs easily enough. Titania, I’m leaving Ike in your care. I’m trusting you to show him the ropes.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Understood, Commander.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Come on, Ike. Let’s get you set up.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right...My first job.

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: Captain Titania. Preparations are complete, and I’m ready to go.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Impeccable timing. It’s nice to know we can always count on you to be at the ready, Oscar.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Don’t forget about me! I’m ready for action!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Is that so, Boyd? That’s a surprise.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Ha! Not today it isn’t.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: As of today, I am going to be the absolute model of perfection. I need to set a good example for Ike!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’ll take your word for it.

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: Your first campaign at last. I know you’ve wanted this for a while. Are you nervous,Ike?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I think I was more nervous last night. I could hardly sleep. This morning, I’m feeling pretty good. It’s the calm before the storm.

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: You should try to relax. You’re not going to be out there alone.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yeah, you’re right.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Right. Everyone ready? Let’s go.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: This is the village of Caldea. The bandits are few, but we mustn’t get careless. Our goal is to take out the bandit leader in front of the large building, and then secure that building.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: All right, let me explain what’s going on.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: This is a map of Caldea. They’ve hired us to drive off some bandits. We’re the blue marks here. The red marks are the bandits.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: There aren’t many of them, but we can’t get careless. The one in front of the building up north is their leader.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Our mission is to take him out and recapture that building.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Ike! Listen up! All this stuff is old news to me, but I can give a rookie like you a few tips. First off, don’t let yourself get worked up and jump out in front of everyone. You’ll just end up getting hurt.

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: Don’t try to do too much, Ike. When things get dangerous, you can–and should–rely on us. As long as you watch how the enemy moves carefully, you’ll be fine. Think of this as a training mission.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’ll do that. Oscar, Boyd, thanks for your help.

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: Don’t mention it.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Just sit back and watch how a professional handles things!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Enough chitchat, you three! We’ve got work to do!

battle.speaker: Titania
battle.line: Ike, before you engage an enemy, take a good look at his weapon. The weapon you use often determines who has the upper hand in a fight. For example, the axe I’m wielding serves me well against lances, but it fares less well against swords.

battle.speaker: Oscar
battle.line: And my lance is great against swords but not against axes. And to complete the triangle...

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Ah! My sword. It’s strong against axes, but weak against lances. Right?

battle.speaker: Titania
battle.line: Yes, exactly. If you can remember that, you’ll be more effective in combat.

battle.speaker: Boyd
battle.line: That’s just the basics, though. This’ll come in handy soon enough, so don’t forget it.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Swords over axes...I won’t forget. Not if I remember that I’ll always have the advantage over you, Boyd.

battle.speaker: Boyd
battle.line: Do you think you could maybe find a different way of remembering? Yeah, thanks.

battle.speaker: Titania
battle.line: And one more thing...Don’t forget to visit the locals. We’re here to help, after all. The villagers should welcome our presence.

battle.speaker: Zawanar
battle.line: What’s going on out there? Is that some sort of army? Pah. A bunch of mercenaries looking for their next meal. The villagers must’ve hired ’em. Listen up, lads! Hurt ’em, and hurt ’em bad! We let this bunch live, and we’ll have hordes of hired swords hounding us the rest of our days!

battle.speaker: Bandit
battle.line: It’s those fool villagers...They think they can buy a bunch of sellswords to chase us away. It ain’t gonna work out how they wanted. All they get for their trouble is a bunch of ruined houses. Tear’em down, boys! That’ll teach ’em!

battle.speaker: Bandit
battle.line: My work here is done. This house is totalled! Time to move on to bigger things. Now, I smash me some mercenaries.

boss.speaker: Zawanar
boss.line: You looking for something, fool? You looking for a fight? Heh heh... You came to the right place. I’ll give you a tussle!

boss.speaker: Zawanar
boss.line: I...I’m meant for better than this...I don’t want to die here...

boss.speaker: Zawanar
boss.line: Hey, you’re nothing but a boy. Well, every brat needs a beating now and then. Are you ready for it?

boss.speaker: Ike
boss.line: Not today.If you want to run away, now’s your chance.

boss.speaker: Zawanar
boss.line: Heh heh heh. Imagine that, you sassing me. Don’t that beat all?

character-falls.speaker: Titania
character-falls.line: Despite my own warnings, I let my guard down, and I got beaten. Ha ha...urgh...

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: That’s the end of it. Ike, are you all right?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: You know, you surprised me. To think that you’ve come so far.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Look at my father, though. I’ve still got such a long way to go.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: There’s nothing you can do about that. After all, Commander Greil is–

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Don’t worry. You’ll learn all about it someday.

end.speaker: Boyd
end.line: Hey, Ike! that wasn’t bad for your first battle. Not as flashy as my first time, though!

end.speaker: Oscar
end.line: Yeah, you were a real standout. I’ll never forget the sight of you so keyed up you broke your own axe.

end.speaker: Boyd
end.line: Oscar! Dang it! You didn’t have to bring that up!

end.speaker: Oscar
end.line: Anyway, Ike. Congrats on finishing your first mission.Welcome to the group.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Everyone’s all right? Then let’s get going. I’m sure Mist has a nice, hot meal waiting for us.
